sub_title: Senior Scrum Lead (PSM2) | Driving Agile Excellence at Nike HQs
summary:
Empathic metrics-driven Senior Scrum Lead (PSM2) with years of experience who has a track record of successfully managing cross-functional onsite/remote DevOps teams and delivering high-quality products on time. Knowledgeable with Agile techniques and Scrum/Kanban practices, as well as dedicated to fostering a culture of cooperation, openness, and continuous development. Adept at leading daily Scrum meetings, shared improvements, retrospectives, and sprint reviews to ensure the team's success. Excellent leadership and communication abilities, ability to coach and guide team members and quickly and effectively handle problems. Metrics-driven to fulfil corporate goals and produce outcomes while boosting team morale and creating a great work environment.

Currently, I am driving success in the online Retail domain (transactions) at Nike's European HQs, where I have been working as a Scrum Master since 2018. My role involves working closely with Nike's distributed Devops teams in the EU and USA to facilitate the global rollout of Self Checkout, both Front-End and Back-End.

Nothing brings me greater joy than watching my global Scrum and Kanban teams flourish and evolve over time. I feel a strong feeling of pride every time I successfully complete a Kiosk Self Checkout transaction at a Nike retail location. It is the fruition of the labor and commitment of our skilled teams at Nike, who were in charge of the international rollout of the retail store self-checkout.

I have a diverse professional background that includes experience as a software developer, IT manager, business analyst, and entrepreneur. This varied experience has proven to be valuable in my current role as a Scrum Lead.

[{'company': {'id': 2029, 'name': 'Nike', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFckBxRnPg53Q/company-logo_400_400/0/1561999707114?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=hZkq6QMIxvqCWcjjpOgXeV8hv4LqmB5Hqys22BLIFT8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/nike/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Hilversum, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Nike', 'description': "As a Senior Scrum Lead at Nike's European headquarters, I'm dedicated to helping distributed DevOps Scrum teams continuously improve in the online retail domain. The teams are based in the EU and USA, and we provide 24-hour on-call support worldwide.

On the technical side, my distributed backend teams develop backend APIs that support several in-store and digital retail services. We deploy these APIs as a cluster of microservices on the cloud infrastructure of AWS, using frameworks such as Spring Boot, Micronaut, and Node.js, and programming languages such as Java and JavaScript. Meanwhile, the front-end team consumes these APIs and is responsible for creating the Assist Client, Kiosk Self Checkout, and the Nike Point of Sales App.

Over the years, I have worked in Tokyo, London, Moscow, New York, and Amsterdam, expanding my global perspective.

Our team played a pivotal role in implementing online and mobile solutions for McKinsey & Company globally, collaborating with Tripoints Consulting in the USA. One standout example from our portfolio is an innovative and secure multi-channel online/mobile Benchmark solution for McKinsey BTO (Business Technology Office). This solution is designed to diagnose performance gaps in bank/telecom operations and technology, as well as identify improvement opportunities. Today, the Benchmark solution is used by more than 200 banks and 80+ telecom providers worldwide.

In addition, we were responsible for creating an advanced mobile event app for McKinsey & Company, streamlining the management of events for the firm.

As a seasoned professional with a successful startup and an offer to join McKinsey & Company as a partner, I made a deliberate choice to step away from the corporate world. I have no regrets about my decision, as it afforded me the opportunity to spend valuable time with my family. Now, I am able to concentrate on my passion for working in an agile environment with global software development teams.
